data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you face forward, you can take 9 steps left. And if you look to the right, you can take 10 steps forward. You take 9 steps right and 10 steps backward. Just like when you face forward you can take 9 steps forward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around and turn right, you will enter your starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You take 4 steps for 6 steps + 4 steps = 10 steps. To take 8 steps, you need 4 steps + 10 steps = 20 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Step 7 : Take 1 step. Step 7 : Take 7 steps. Turn left : Take 5 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning left at the beginning points to come back to the start. So the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn left, you get left. Turn around, you get turned around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 8 steps after turning, you will still take 8 steps to get back to starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You would have no way of turning around in 6 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you can always take 1 step left and come to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You will take the 3 steps and turn around. The first 2 steps equal 4 steps. The 7th step equals 7 steps. The first 3 steps equals 1 step. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you are facing forward you can not take a steps backward. The answer: No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you follow the instructions from the beginning point, you always face forward. The shortest path is 1 step backward so you take 1 step backward. If you follow the instructions to a second, you would have to take 6 steps backward at a rate of 1 step back each time. The easiest way to return to the starting point is to take 2 steps left at a rate of 5 steps left at a rate of 2 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward from the starting point, you can return to your starting point by taking 10 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always forward face forward, you can return to the starting point. If you take 3 steps forward, you can return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The walking guide point is always to one side. One does not always go backward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After turning around you return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow the instructions correctly, you will return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Turning right is a way to get to the starting point. You are given alternate options and each choice is only possible once you are in your starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around, then take 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 12, 14, back to beginning point. Yes, take 7 steps to turn left. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In all of the steps, you are going to return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person can return to the starting point if they follow one of the following instructions: Take 5 steps. Take 2 steps. Take 5 steps. If you follow one of the following instructions: Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. If you follow one of the following instructions: Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. No. One does not turn around. If you take 5 steps, you take five steps back to your starting point. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You need to turn around in the first step. Turn around means you must go back and take 7 steps again. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You start facing forward and are 7 steps left. You are 7 steps left, 2 steps right, 2 steps left, 7 steps forward and 7 steps right. 8 steps left, 5 steps right, 7 steps forward, 7 steps right and 7 steps forward. 8 + 7 = 11 steps away from the starting point. To come back to the starting point is to go back 5 steps in one direction. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Rewarding backwards can only take you so far. If you look forward, you can only take five steps forward. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around and take four steps back. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After taking 6 steps left, you can always go back to where you started by taking 6 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
There are 5 steps which are the 5 steps to the starting point. This leaves 5 steps when you turn around which is 5 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always take 1 way backward from the starting point on both directions. If you take 2 steps forward, you can always take 2 steps forward. Therefore, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you took 1 step, you would surely be going back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

Turn around is the same as take 9 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The original instructions had 10 steps right so there is 8 steps backward. If you can return to the starting point, there will be 10 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 1 step. You return to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is the place you are facing forward. When you take 4 steps backward, you take 9 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The person goes one step backward with one step left. If you take 5 steps left, you should be facing the advantgeant forward. If you take 4 steps right and one step backward, you should be facing the right advantgeant. If you take 6 steps left, you should be facing the left advantgeant. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Your first position begins where you start, so you always see forward. If you are facing away from the wall, you move backward with your back to the wall, facing forward with your left foot still. If you are facing forward with your left foot still, you move forward with your left foot still to the wall, facing right, taking 7 steps left. If you are facing straight forward and you are facing away from the wall, you move backward with your left foot to meet with the wall at your starting point. This is logical, because then you would actually be moving back in the opposite direction. So, the answer is yes.

You can take several steps to turn around from 8 steps to 2 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Take 9 steps backward. Take 1 step backward. So, the answer is Yes.

Face Forward always takes 6 steps. Follow the directions and go backward. Take 7 steps left. Go backward 4 total times. Take 8 total times. Turn yourself around again. Take three steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

Every time you' re going from side to side on a circle, face forward and take 6 steps forward, until you bring yourself back on to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

The starting point is either in the right place or in the far right place. The only place you would return to is the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

Every step in the direction described is the same. Taking 4 steps left is the last step done when facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

Place your hand on your thigh to see the same direction as your back. Face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 4 steps backward (always facing forward) Take 8 steps left. Place your hand on your knee to see the same direction as your back. Face forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

Face forward every time you walk. The starting point is always facing forward. Taking 7 steps backward is a backward move. Taking 10 steps right is a right move. Getting back to the starting point is a forward movement in one direction. So, the answer is Yes.
